1. Pre-operative: This term refers to the time period before a surgical procedure. It includes the diagnosis, evaluation, and preparation of the patient for the surgery. In this context, it is not directly related to a specific disease entity.

2. Intra-operative: This term refers to the period during a surgical procedure. It includes the actual performance of the surgery and any interventions that may occur during the procedure. Again, it is not directly related to a specific disease entity.

3. Post-operative: This term refers to the time period after a surgical procedure. It includes the recovery and follow-up care of the patient.
